case_vignette: A 19-year-old man comes to the physician for the evaluation of progressive difficulty climbing stairs over the last 2 years. During this period, he has also had problems with running, occasional falls, and standing from a chair. He has not had any vision problems or muscle cramping. There is no personal or family history of serious illness. Neurological examination shows deep tendon reflexes are 2+ bilaterally and sensation to pinprick and light touch is normal. Musculoskeletal examination shows enlarged calf muscles bilaterally. He has a waddling gait. Laboratory studies show a creatine kinase level of 1700 U/L.
question: Which  is the most appropriate next step to confirm the diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Neurology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been having trouble climbing stairs, running, and I've been falling occasionally, as well as struggling to stand up from a chair for the past 2 years.
Understood. Could you please tell me your age and sex?
I'm a 19-year-old man.
Have you experienced any muscle weakness or loss of muscle mass?
I haven't lost any muscle mass; actually, my calf muscles have gotten bigger.
Okay, have you noticed any changes in your speech or difficulty swallowing?
No, I haven't had any problems with my speech or swallowing.
Got it. Have you experienced any pain, cramping, or stiffness in your muscles?
No, I haven't had any muscle pain, cramping, or stiffness.
Do you have a family history of any neuromuscular disorders or similar symptoms?
No, there's no family history of serious illness.
Are you currently taking any medications for any other conditions?
No, I'm not on any medications.
**Final Diagnosis:** Duchenne muscular dystrophy

I've been having trouble climbing stairs for the last 2 years, and I also have problems with running, I fall sometimes, and it's difficult for me to stand up from a chair.

I am 19 years old.
